text:
<!here|@here>: 
hey team,

while not everyone will have ‘something to report’ in stand up today, i’d like to catch you up on the latest dev cycle planning.  take a look here in advance - 

we’re sprinting on 1.02: <https://uncorkedstudios.atlassian.net/browse/BWB-387>
	•	We’re targeting a Release to BL team on Monday.  
	•	In order to do so, we need to lint code today and drop to Myles before we can package up the 1.02 released

Each day, depending upon progress, we’ll target test and accept changes on Peter’s local machine.  
	⁃	I’ll scramble the right resources between Joel, Justin and Emily depending upon what we’re reviewing.

We’ll do 1-2 reviews on full wall rig to check out all of the changes in harmony and smoke test the larger code base.  This will likely happen EOD tomorrow/first thing Thursday.
hey <@U0J6TE0CA> i uploaded some photos to our media folder on gDrive: <https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B_zm1M0wiMFYeTZfMVYxcXc1dWs>
for your work on case study video.  let me know how else i might be able to help
<@U0J6TE0CA>: here are all the ones I found in my stash <https://goo.gl/photos/b2HURPP3PF9zVyux6>

attachments.title: Brandlab Wall
attachments.text: 100 new photos · Album by Peter Bliss

text:
<!here|@here>: i just met with peter.  he’s got pretty much all of his 1.02 stuff on his local ready for further acceptance testing.  i’ve seen it all and i think it’d be good for joel and design team to check it out, apply any refinements and then he’ll update master templates and do a  build on the full rig tomorrow.  i’m looking for time to book emily, justin and joel.  

- Cubby questions: selection dot should always come in before answer text
- Cubby animation: Questions>> BUBBLES (applied to Skip only, needs to be applied to third answer)
- Welcome Top Sweep: Sort video left (most watched) right (3rd most watched)
- Cubby: Sweep all copy for widows!
- Cubby Bubbles - Initials
let’s use stand up time tomorrow
Any idea if/when we are going to have access to the footage they shot of the mock session for BrandLab?

<@U0J6TE0CA>: we likely wont have access to raw footage.  client paid for that and will be in charge of that cut.  does your current idea hinge on having that footage or do we have alt stuff we could use?
We have yet to meet, but I am thinking footage will go a long long way.
